THE ADVENTURE OF St. PATRICK.

MMBBP St. PATRICK OP IRELAND " w a B a gentleman," and "behaved himself as such," by rescuing from the Wild
Men the Six Daughters of the King of Thrace, who came over in search of St. Andrew j and by driving all the venomous reptiles
out of the Emerald Isle into the Atlantic Ocean.

SEVEN

TIME A D V E N T U R E O F S t . P A T R I C K .
B O W S t . F A T R I C R O F I R E L A N D "' w»s a gentleman,'' and "behaved himself as such," by rescuing from the Will

H O W S t . D A V I D O F " W A L E S essayed the adi enture of the Magic Sword, fill.-., ' Chaese-toaiter" and fell asleep ..Tor
it; and how, after many adventures which are left to the imagination of the Audience, St. George, St. Andre w and St, Patriot, cam*
